Articles.Content:
First, here are my specs

 

8gb DDR(3?)

intel HD520

intel i7

windows 10

when I play other more demanding games, like subnautica it runs fine, but I feel that a less demanding game like ksp should play better? It's mainly lag when I have a higher up part count, and get this, when I look at the engines of a ship, it's framerate is perfect, but if I look at the nose of the plane or ship, it lags a bit? I twaddled with the settings that I didn't understand, like v-sync and shaders and all that, did I mess something up? It ran fine before? And after my first flight, the edge highlights went away, and my shadows slowly disappeared as I played?!

So you have a small plane and just have problems with it when changing the view?

u could delete the settings file ion ksp directory forcing it to set all done config to "default"

 

About the Part count: there are ENOUGH threads already - and as a new forum member u should fairly learn to use the search function or even check the first side of THIS Topic!.

Short: its about your CPU that cant handle a high amount of physic calculations. Will change with KSP 1.1 slightly.

Edited January 5, 2016 by Speadge
